2.text: “Truly then you are the people with whom wisdom itself will die!

3.text: But I also have a mind; I am not inferior to you. Who does not know such things as these?

4.text: I am a laughingstock to my friends, though I called on God, and He answered. The righteous and upright man is a laughingstock.

5.text: The one at ease scorns misfortune as the fate of those whose feet are slipping.

6.text: The tents of robbers are safe, and those who provoke God are secure—those who carry their god in their hands.

7.text: But ask the animals, and they will instruct you; ask the birds of the air, and they will tell you.

8.text: Or speak to the earth, and it will teach you; let the fish of the sea inform you.

9.text: Which of all these does not know that the hand of the LORD has done this?

10.text: The life of every living thing is in His hand, as well as the breath of all mankind.

11.text: Does not the ear test words as the tongue tastes its food?

12.text: Wisdom is found with the elderly, and understanding comes with long life.

13.text: Wisdom and strength belong to God; counsel and understanding are His.

14.text: What He tears down cannot be rebuilt; the man He imprisons cannot be released.

15.text: If He holds back the waters, they dry up, and if He releases them, they overwhelm the land.

16.text: True wisdom and power belong to Him. The deceived and the deceiver are His.

17.text: He leads counselors away barefoot and makes fools of judges.

18.text: He loosens the bonds placed by kings and fastens a belt around their waists.

19.text: He leads priests away barefoot and overthrows the established.

20.text: He deprives the trusted of speech and takes away the discernment of elders.

21.text: He pours out contempt on nobles and disarms the mighty.

22.text: He reveals the deep things of darkness and brings deep shadows into light.

23.text: He makes nations great and destroys them; He enlarges nations, then disperses them.

24.text: He deprives the earth’s leaders of reason and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.

25.text: They grope in the darkness without light; He makes them stagger like drunkards.
